UI_visible_response: Read 21 web pagesView Page DetailsVocational Skills Education and Training Centers (VSETCs) are a system of residential training centers established by the authorities of Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region (XUAR) in 2017 through a “De-Extremification Regulation.” These centers are officially described as institutions aimed at developing the skills of disadvantaged minority peoples in XUAR to improve their employability and promote stable employment. However, there is extensive evidence suggesting that these centers function as prisons, with practices such as hooding, shackling, handcuffing, and shoot-to-kill orders for those attempting escape. Between 1 and 2 million people from Uyghur, Kazakh, and other minorities may have been involuntarily detained in these centers. The detention is notionally administrative and preventive, based on suspicion of “infection” with dangerous incorrect thinking such as separatism or religious extremism.
